00035 #define ELE_NEW     1
00036 
00037 typedef struct SplitEdgeInfo {
00038     float   no[3];
00039     float   length;
00040     BMEdge *e_old;
00041     BMEdge *e_new;
00042     BMLoop *l;
00043 } SplitEdgeInfo;
00044 
00053 static BMLoop *bm_edge_is_mixed_face_tag(BMLoop *l)
00054 {
00055     if (LIKELY(l != NULL)) {
00056         int tot_tag = 0;
00057         int tot_untag = 0;
00058         BMLoop *l_iter;
00059         BMLoop *l_tag = NULL;
00060         l_iter = l;
00061         do {
00062             if (BM_elem_flag_test(l_iter->f, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00063                 /* more then one tagged face - bail out early! */
00064                 if (tot_tag == 1) {
00065                     return NULL;
00066                 }
00067                 l_tag = l_iter;
00068                 tot_tag++;
00069             }
00070             else {
00071                 tot_untag++;
00072             }
00073 
00074         } while ((l_iter = l_iter->radial_next) != l);
00075 
00076         return ((tot_tag == 1) && (tot_untag >= 1)) ? l_tag : NULL;
00077     }
00078     else {
00079         return NULL;
00080     }
00081 }
00082 
00083 float bm_vert_avg_tag_dist(BMVert *v)
00084 {
00085     BMIter iter;
00086     BMEdge *e;
00087     int tot;
00088     float length = 0.0f;
00089 
00090     BM_ITER_ELEM_INDEX (e, &iter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT, tot) {
00091         BMVert *v_other = BM_edge_other_vert(e, v);
00092         if (BM_elem_flag_test(v_other, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00093             length += BM_edge_calc_length(e);
00094         }
00095     }
00096 
00097     return length / (float)tot;
00098 }
00099 
00110 void bmo_inset_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00111 {
00112     const int use_outset          = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "use_outset");
00113     const int use_boundary        = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "use_boundary") && (use_outset == FALSE);
00114     const int use_even_offset     = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "use_even_offset");
00115     const int use_even_boundry    = use_even_offset; /* could make own option */
00116     const int use_relative_offset = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "use_relative_offset");
00117     const float thickness         = BMO_slot_float_get(op, "thickness");
00118     const float depth             = BMO_slot_float_get(op, "depth");
00119 
00120     int edge_info_len = 0;
00121 
00122     BMIter iter;
00123     SplitEdgeInfo *edge_info;
00124     SplitEdgeInfo *es;
00125 
00126     BMVert *v;
00127     BMEdge *e;
00128     BMFace *f;
00129     int i, j, k;
00130 
00131     if (use_outset == FALSE) {
00132         BM_mesh_elem_hflag_disable_all(bm, BM_FACE, BM_ELEM_TAG, FALSE);
00133         BMO_slot_buffer_hflag_enable(bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE, BM_ELEM_TAG, FALSE);
00134     }
00135     else {
00136         BM_mesh_elem_hflag_enable_all(bm, BM_FACE, BM_ELEM_TAG, FALSE);
00137         BMO_slot_buffer_hflag_disable(bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE, BM_ELEM_TAG, FALSE);
00138     }
00139 
00140     /* first count all inset edges we will split */
00141     /* fill in array and initialize tagging */
00142     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00143         if (
00144             /* tag if boundary is enabled */
00145             (use_boundary && BM_edge_is_boundary(e) && BM_elem_flag_test(e->l->f, BM_ELEM_TAG)) ||
00146 
00147             /* tag if edge is an interior edge inbetween a tagged and untagged face */
00148             (bm_edge_is_mixed_face_tag(e->l)))
00149         {
00150             /* tag */
00151             BM_elem_flag_enable(e->v1, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00152             BM_elem_flag_enable(e->v2, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00153             BM_elem_flag_enable(e, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00154 
00155             BM_elem_index_set(e, edge_info_len); /* set_dirty! */
00156             edge_info_len++;
00157         }
00158         else {
00159             BM_elem_flag_disable(e->v1, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00160             BM_elem_flag_disable(e->v2, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00161             BM_elem_flag_disable(e, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00162 
00163             BM_elem_index_set(e, -1); /* set_dirty! */
00164         }
00165     }
00166     bm->elem_index_dirty |= BM_EDGE;
00167 
00168     edge_info = MEM_mallocN(edge_info_len * sizeof(SplitEdgeInfo), __func__);
00169 
00170     /* fill in array and initialize tagging */
00171     es = edge_info;
00172     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00173         i = BM_elem_index_get(e);
00174         if (i != -1) {
00175             /* calc edge-split info */
00176             es->length = BM_edge_calc_length(e);
00177             es->e_old = e;
00178             es++;
00179             /* initialize no and e_new after */
00180         }
00181     }
00182 
00183     for (i = 0, es = edge_info; i < edge_info_len; i++, es++) {
00184         if ((es->l = bm_edge_is_mixed_face_tag(es->e_old->l))) {
00185             /* do nothing */
00186         }
00187         else {
00188             es->l = es->e_old->l; /* must be a boundary */
00189         }
00190 
00191 
00192         /* run the separate arg */
00193         bmesh_edge_separate(bm, es->e_old, es->l);
00194 
00195         /* calc edge-split info */
00196         es->e_new = es->l->e;
00197         BM_edge_calc_face_tangent(es->e_new, es->l, es->no);
00198 
00199         if (es->e_new == es->e_old) { /* happens on boundary edges */
00200             /* take care here, we're creating this double edge which _must_ have its verts replaced later on */
00201             es->e_old = BM_edge_create(bm, es->e_new->v1, es->e_new->v2, es->e_new, FALSE);
00202         }
00203 
00204         /* store index back to original in 'edge_info' */
00205         BM_elem_index_set(es->e_new, i);
00206         BM_elem_flag_enable(es->e_new, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00207 
00208         /* important to tag again here */
00209         BM_elem_flag_enable(es->e_new->v1, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00210         BM_elem_flag_enable(es->e_new->v2, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00211     }
00212 
00213 
00214     /* show edge normals for debugging */
00215 #if 0
00216     for (i = 0, es = edge_info; i < edge_info_len; i++, es++) {
00217         float tvec[3];
00218         BMVert *v1, *v2;
00219 
00220         mid_v3_v3v3(tvec, es->e_new->v1->co, es->e_new->v2->co);
00221 
00222         v1 = BM_vert_create(bm, tvec, NULL);
00223         v2 = BM_vert_create(bm, tvec, NULL);
00224         madd_v3_v3fl(v2->co, es->no, 0.1f);
00225         BM_edge_create(bm, v1, v2, NULL, FALSE);
00226     }
00227 #endif
00228 
00229     /* execute the split and position verts, it would be most obvious to loop over verts
00230      * here but don't do this since we will be splitting them off (iterating stuff you modify is bad juju)
00231      * instead loop over edges then their verts */
00232     for (i = 0, es = edge_info; i < edge_info_len; i++, es++) {
00233         for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
00234             v = (j == 0) ? es->e_new->v1 : es->e_new->v2;
00235 
00236             /* end confusing part - just pretend this is a typical loop on verts */
00237 
00238             /* only split of tagged verts - used by separated edges */
00239 
00240             /* comment the first part because we know this verts in a tagged face */
00241             if (/* v->e && */BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00242                 BMVert **vout;
00243                 int r_vout_len;
00244                 BMVert *v_glue = NULL;
00245 
00246                 /* disable touching twice, this _will_ happen if the flags not disabled */
00247                 BM_elem_flag_disable(v, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00248 
00249                 bmesh_vert_separate(bm, v, &vout, &r_vout_len);
00250                 v = NULL; /* don't use again */
00251 
00252                 /* in some cases the edge doesn't split off */
00253                 if (r_vout_len == 1) {
00254                     MEM_freeN(vout);
00255                     continue;
00256                 }
00257 
00258                 for (k = 0; k < r_vout_len; k++) {
00259                     BMVert *v_split = vout[k]; /* only to avoid vout[k] all over */
00260 
00261                     /* need to check if this vertex is from a */
00262                     int vert_edge_tag_tot = 0;
00263                     int vecpair[2];
00264 
00265                     /* find adjacent */
00266                     BM_ITER_ELEM (e, &iter, v_split, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00267                         if (BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_TAG) &&
00268                             e->l && BM_elem_flag_test(e->l->f, BM_ELEM_TAG))
00269                         {
00270                             if (vert_edge_tag_tot < 2) {
00271                                 vecpair[vert_edge_tag_tot] = BM_elem_index_get(e);
00272                                 BLI_assert(vecpair[vert_edge_tag_tot] != -1);
00273                             }
00274 
00275                             vert_edge_tag_tot++;
00276                         }
00277                     }
00278 
00279                     if (vert_edge_tag_tot != 0) {
00280                         float tvec[3];
00281 
00282                         if (vert_edge_tag_tot >= 2) { /* 2 edge users - common case */
00283                             /* now there are 2 cases to check for,
00284                              *
00285                              * if both edges use the same face OR both faces have the same normal,
00286                              * ...then we can calculate an edge that fits nicely between the 2 edge normals.
00287                              *
00288                              * Otherwise use the shared edge OR the corner defined by these 2 face normals,
00289                              * when both edges faces are adjacent this works best but even when this vertex
00290                              * fans out faces it should work ok.
00291                              */
00292 
00293                             SplitEdgeInfo *e_info_a = &edge_info[vecpair[0]];
00294                             SplitEdgeInfo *e_info_b = &edge_info[vecpair[1]];
00295 
00296                             BMFace *f_a = e_info_a->l->f;
00297                             BMFace *f_b = e_info_b->l->f;
00298 
00299                             /* we use this as either the normal OR to find the right direction for the
00300                              * crpss product between both face normals */
00301                             add_v3_v3v3(tvec, e_info_a->no, e_info_b->no);
00302 
00303                             if ((f_a == f_b) || compare_v3v3(f_a->no, f_b->no, 0.00001f)) {
00304                                 normalize_v3(tvec);
00305                             }
00306                             else {
00307                                 /* these lookups are very quick */
00308                                 BMLoop *l_other_a = BM_loop_other_vert_loop(e_info_a->l, v_split);
00309                                 BMLoop *l_other_b = BM_loop_other_vert_loop(e_info_b->l, v_split);
00310 
00311                                 if (l_other_a->v == l_other_b->v) {
00312                                     /* both edges faces are adjacent, but we don't need to know the shared edge
00313                                      * having both verts is enough. */
00314                                     sub_v3_v3v3(tvec, l_other_a->v->co, v_split->co);
00315                                 }
00316                                 else {
00317                                     /* faces don't touch,
00318                                      * just get cross product of their normals, its *good enough*
00319                                      */
00320                                     float tno[3];
00321                                     cross_v3_v3v3(tno, f_a->no, f_b->no);
00322                                     if (dot_v3v3(tvec, tno) < 0.0f) {
00323                                         negate_v3(tno);
00324                                     }
00325                                     copy_v3_v3(tvec, tno);
00326                                 }
00327 
00328                                 normalize_v3(tvec);
00329                             }
00330 
00331                             /* scale by edge angle */
00332                             if (use_even_offset) {
00333                                 mul_v3_fl(tvec, shell_angle_to_dist(angle_normalized_v3v3(e_info_a->no, e_info_b->no) / 2.0f));
00334                             }
00335 
00336                             /* scale relative to edge lengths */
00337                             if (use_relative_offset) {
00338                                 mul_v3_fl(tvec, (edge_info[vecpair[0]].length + edge_info[vecpair[1]].length) / 2.0f);
00339                             }
00340                         }
00341                         else if (vert_edge_tag_tot == 1) { /* 1 edge user - boundary vert, not so common */
00342                             const float *e_no_a = edge_info[vecpair[0]].no;
00343 
00344                             if (use_even_boundry) {
00345 
00346                                 /* This case where only one edge attached to v_split
00347                                  * is used - ei - the face to inset is on a boundary.
00348                                  *
00349                                  *                  We want the inset to align flush with the
00350                                  *                  boundary edge, not the normal of the interior
00351                                  *             <--- edge which would give an unsightly bump.
00352                                  * --+-------------------------+---------------+--
00353                                  *   |^v_other    ^e_other    /^v_split        |
00354                                  *   |                       /                 |
00355                                  *   |                      /                  |
00356                                  *   |                     / <- tag split edge |
00357                                  *   |                    /                    |
00358                                  *   |                   /                     |
00359                                  *   |                  /                      |
00360                                  * --+-----------------+-----------------------+--
00361                                  *   |                                         |
00362                                  *   |                                         |
00363                                  *
00364                                  * note, the fact we are doing location comparisons on verts that are moved about
00365                                  * doesn't matter because the direction will remain the same in this case.
00366                                  */
00367 
00368                                 BMEdge *e_other;
00369                                 BMVert *v_other;
00370                                 /* loop will always be either next of prev */
00371                                 BMLoop *l = v_split->e->l;
00372                                 if (l->prev->v == v_split) {
00373                                     l = l->prev;
00374                                 }
00375                                 else if (l->next->v == v_split) {
00376                                     l = l->next;
00377                                 }
00378                                 else if (l->v == v_split) {
00379                                     /* pass */
00380                                 }
00381                                 else {
00382                                     /* should never happen */
00383                                     BLI_assert(0);
00384                                 }
00385 
00386                                 /* find the edge which is _not_ being split here */
00387                                 if (!BM_elem_flag_test(l->e, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00388                                     e_other = l->e;
00389                                 }
00390                                 else if (!BM_elem_flag_test(l->prev->e, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00391                                     e_other = l->prev->e;
00392                                 }
00393                                 else {
00394                                     BLI_assert(0);
00395                                     e_other = NULL;
00396                                 }
00397 
00398                                 v_other = BM_edge_other_vert(e_other, v_split);
00399                                 sub_v3_v3v3(tvec, v_other->co, v_split->co);
00400                                 normalize_v3(tvec);
00401 
00402                                 if (use_even_offset) {
00403                                     mul_v3_fl(tvec, shell_angle_to_dist(angle_normalized_v3v3(e_no_a, tvec)));
00404                                 }
00405                             }
00406                             else {
00407                                 copy_v3_v3(tvec, e_no_a);
00408                             }
00409 
00410                             /* use_even_offset - doesn't apply here */
00411 
00412                             /* scale relative to edge length */
00413                             if (use_relative_offset) {
00414                                 mul_v3_fl(tvec, edge_info[vecpair[0]].length);
00415                             }
00416                         }
00417                         else {
00418                             /* should never happen */
00419                             BLI_assert(0);
00420                             zero_v3(tvec);
00421                         }
00422 
00423                         /* apply the offset */
00424                         madd_v3_v3fl(v_split->co, tvec, thickness);
00425                     }
00426 
00427                     /* this saves expensive/slow glue check for common cases */
00428                     if (r_vout_len > 2) {
00429                         int ok = TRUE;
00430                         /* last step, NULL this vertex if has a tagged face */
00431                         BM_ITER_ELEM (f, &iter, v_split, BM_FACES_OF_VERT) {
00432                             if (BM_elem_flag_test(f, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00433                                 ok = FALSE;
00434                                 break;
00435                             }
00436                         }
00437 
00438                         if (ok) {
00439                             if (v_glue == NULL) {
00440                                 v_glue = v_split;
00441                             }
00442                             else {
00443                                 BM_vert_splice(bm, v_split, v_glue);
00444                             }
00445                         }
00446                     }
00447                     /* end glue */
00448 
00449                 }
00450                 MEM_freeN(vout);
00451             }
00452         }
00453     }
00454 
00455     /* create faces */
00456     for (i = 0, es = edge_info; i < edge_info_len; i++, es++) {
00457         BMVert *varr[4] = {NULL};
00458         /* get the verts in the correct order */
00459         BM_edge_ordered_verts_ex(es->e_new, &varr[1], &varr[0], es->l);
00460 #if 0
00461         if (varr[0] == es->e_new->v1) {
00462             varr[2] = es->e_old->v2;
00463             varr[3] = es->e_old->v1;
00464         }
00465         else {
00466             varr[2] = es->e_old->v1;
00467             varr[3] = es->e_old->v2;
00468         }
00469         j = 4;
00470 #else
00471         /* slightly trickier check - since we can't assume the verts are split */
00472         j = 2; /* 2 edges are set */
00473         if (varr[0] == es->e_new->v1) {
00474             if (es->e_old->v2 != es->e_new->v2) { varr[j++] = es->e_old->v2; }
00475             if (es->e_old->v1 != es->e_new->v1) { varr[j++] = es->e_old->v1; }
00476         }
00477         else {
00478             if (es->e_old->v1 != es->e_new->v1) { varr[j++] = es->e_old->v1; }
00479             if (es->e_old->v2 != es->e_new->v2) { varr[j++] = es->e_old->v2; }
00480         }
00481 
00482         if (j == 2) {
00483             /* can't make face! */
00484             continue;
00485         }
00486 #endif
00487         /* no need to check doubles, we KNOW there won't be any */
00488         /* yes - reverse face is correct in this case */
00489         f = BM_face_create_quad_tri_v(bm, varr, j, es->l->f, FALSE);
00490         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, f, ELE_NEW);
00491 
00492         /* copy for loop data, otherwise UV's and vcols are no good.
00493          * tiny speedup here we could be more clever and copy from known adjacent data
00494          * also - we could attempt to interpolate the loop data, this would be much slower but more useful too */
00495         BM_face_copy_shared(bm, f);
00496     }
00497 
00498     /* we could flag new edges/verts too, is it useful? */
00499     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_flag(bm, op, "faceout", BM_FACE, ELE_NEW);
00500 
00501     /* cheap feature to add depth to the inset */
00502     if (depth != 0.0f) {
00503         float (*varr_co)[3];
00504         BMOIter oiter;
00505 
00506         /* we need to re-calculate tagged normals, but for this purpose we can copy tagged verts from the
00507          * faces they inset from,  */
00508         for (i = 0, es = edge_info; i < edge_info_len; i++, es++) {
00509             zero_v3(es->e_new->v1->no);
00510             zero_v3(es->e_new->v2->no);
00511         }
00512         for (i = 0, es = edge_info; i < edge_info_len; i++, es++) {
00513             float *no = es->l->f->no;
00514             add_v3_v3(es->e_new->v1->no, no);
00515             add_v3_v3(es->e_new->v2->no, no);
00516         }
00517         for (i = 0, es = edge_info; i < edge_info_len; i++, es++) {
00518             /* annoying, avoid normalizing twice */
00519             if (len_squared_v3(es->e_new->v1->no) != 1.0f) {
00520                 normalize_v3(es->e_new->v1->no);
00521             }
00522             if (len_squared_v3(es->e_new->v2->no) != 1.0f) {
00523                 normalize_v3(es->e_new->v2->no);
00524             }
00525         }
00526         /* done correcting edge verts normals */
00527 
00528         /* untag verts */
00529         BM_mesh_elem_hflag_disable_all(bm, BM_VERT, BM_ELEM_TAG, FALSE);
00530 
00531         /* tag face verts */
00532         BMO_ITER (f, &oiter, bm, op, "faces", BM_FACE) {
00533             BM_ITER_ELEM (v, &iter, f, BM_VERTS_OF_FACE) {
00534                 BM_elem_flag_enable(v, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00535             }
00536         }
00537 
00538         /* do in 2 passes so moving the verts doesn't feed back into face angle checks
00539          * which BM_vert_calc_shell_factor uses. */
00540 
00541         /* over allocate */
00542         varr_co = MEM_callocN(sizeof(*varr_co) * bm->totvert, __func__);
00543 
00544         BM_ITER_MESH_INDEX (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH, i) {
00545             if (BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00546                 const float fac = (depth *
00547                                    (use_relative_offset ? bm_vert_avg_tag_dist(v) : 1.0f) *
00548                                    (use_even_boundry    ? BM_vert_calc_shell_factor(v) : 1.0f));
00549                 madd_v3_v3v3fl(varr_co[i], v->co, v->no, fac);
00550             }
00551         }
00552 
00553         BM_ITER_MESH_INDEX (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH, i) {
00554             if (BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00555                 copy_v3_v3(v->co, varr_co[i]);
00556             }
00557         }
00558         MEM_freeN(varr_co);
00559     }
00560 
00561     MEM_freeN(edge_info);
00562 }
